item.title: Residual Covariance
item.description: A Way to Look At Why Your SEM Model Has Poor Fit If you’ve done any Structural Equation Modeling, you’ve run into a bad fitting model. Embarassingly, aside from estimating covariances among correlated variables, I didn’t know much about how to inspect poor model fit until very recently. Enter the residual covariance matrix. It’s a super simple way to examine poor model fit. Here’s an example. You have 6 observed variables, and you want to create a latent factor.
